prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. **Step 1: Draw a 2D Sketch** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0, and translation vector of 0, 0, 0. Begin by sketching on the XY plane. **Step 2: Sketch a Hexagon on the XY Plane** Construct a hexagon on the XY plane using the following lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point (0, 0.1877), End Point (0.124, 0) 2. Line 2: Start Point (0.124, 0), End Point (0.3486, 0.0135) 3. Line 3: Start Point (0.3486, 0.0135), End Point (0.4492, 0.2148) 4. Line 4: Start Point (0.4492, 0.2148), End Point (0.3252, 0.4025) 5. Line 5: Start Point (0.3252, 0.4025), End Point (0.1006, 0.389) 6. Line 6: Start Point (0.1006, 0.389), End Point (0, 0.1877) **Step 3: Scale and Transform the Sketch into a 3D Model** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4492. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D by applying the following euler angles: 0, 0, 0, and translation vector: 0, 0, 0. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.75 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction of the normal. This will result in a final height of the prism equal to 1 unit. At this point, you have completed generating the first part of the CAD assembly, a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Move on to generating the subsequent parts, following the same process outlined above until you have completed the entire CAD assembly.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a simple, two-dimensional shape with straight lines and right angles. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Draw a line from the point [0.0049, 0.0395] to the point [0.0, 0.0395]. 8. Draw a line from the point [0.0, 0.0395] to the point [0.0, 0.0]. The loop consists of 8 lines. Extrusion Extrude the sketch in the direction of the normal by 0.75 units. Set the sketch scale to 0.0592. Part 2: Construct a CAD model of a cylindrical object with three smaller cylinders attached to its sides, all centered on a larger cylinder. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0592, 0.2154, 0.0148]. Sketch Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 1. Draw a circle with its center at the point [0.0049, 0.0049] and a radius of 0.0049. 2. Draw a circle with its center at the point [0.0345, 0.0049] and a radius of 0.0049. 3. Draw a circle with its center at the point [0.0641, 0.0049] and a radius of 0.0049. 4. Draw a circle with its center at the point [0.255, 0.0049] and a radius of 0.0049. 5. Draw a circle with its center at the point [0.2846, 0.0049] and a radius of 0.0049. 6. Draw a circle with its center at the point [0.3142, 0.0049] and a radius of 0.0049. Each loop consists of 1 circle. Extrusion Extrude each sketch in the direction of the opposite normal by 0.0099 units. Set the sketch scale to 0.3191. Perform a cut operation. The final shape is a simple, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, tapering slightly as it rises. It has a diameter of 0.0592 units at the base and 0.0049 units at the top. The prism has a height of 0.75 units and a width of 0.3191 units.</description>
